title: Can You Get Nail Psoriasis from Smoking? I Think I Did

content: I’ve never smoked cigarettes or any tobacco products. However, recently I played around with CBD and herbal smoke blends. I loved the effects of both CBD and the herbal blends I created, but I quickly noticed a change in the health of my fingernails. I wasn’t quite sure what was causing it until I started paying more attention to my habits. When I realized smoking could be the cause, I took a break and reintroduced it later. My nails became brittle, little lines would appear, and I even noticed a bit of pitting as well.

Throughout my life, I’ve always had strong, healthy nails. Seeing a shift in the health of my nails was very new and frustrating for me. I remember hearing about nail psoriasis, but it wasn’t until my personal experience with these symptoms that I decided to do some research on it. Nail psoriasis is actually common, with more than half of psoriasis patients and more than 80% of psoriatic arthritis patients are affected.

content: Nail psoriasis can affect both your fingernails and toenails. Symptoms of nail psoriasis include:

There are different ways to treat nail psoriasis including corticosteroids, medicine injections, oral medication, phototherapy, and laser therapy. I noticed a difference when I stopped smoking. I try to always take a natural approach to healing, so my first step was removing the factor that I believed was contributing to the symptoms I was experiencing. I also incorporated herbs and foods that are great for healthy nails to nurse them back to health.
bullets: Discoloration: Your nail bed is the skin underneath your nails. You may notice a change in color that can appear brown, yellow, or white.
Nail pits: These are tiny dents in your nails that vary in size and can be either shallow or deep.
Buildup beneath the nails, which can look like dead skin
Nail separation: The skin under the tips of your nails can slowly separate, which leads to the risk of developing nail fungus.
Beau’s lines: You may see grooves that run horizontally across the nails.

content: Minerals that assist with healthy nails include:

I have an herbal tea blend on my site that’s high in many minerals and vitamins that may assist with nail health. It includes nettle, horsetail, oat straw, peppermint, and roses. In addition to sipping tea, the herbs can be infused with oil and rubbed on the nails and cuticles daily. Horsetail, nettle, and oat straw are rich in several vitamins, silica, iron, and calcium, which all may contribute to healthier nails.

Some home remedies that may help manage the symptoms include aloe vera, Dead Sea salt, and turmeric. As with everything else, increasing water intake is always beneficial for nail health. I aim for at least half a gallon daily, not including herbal teas or fruits high in water content.
bullets: Calcium: Calcium can be found in dairy, nuts and seeds, leafy greens, salmon, and blackstrap molasses, just to name a few. Vitamin D3 is said to help with the absorption of calcium.
Iron: Some sources of iron include beets, blackstrap molasses, seaweeds, dark leafy greens, seafood, tuna, offs, lentils, peas, dates, and beans.
Zinc: Zinc can be found in red meats, pumpkin seeds, beans, nuts, whole grains, and oysters.

content: If you’re experiencing nail psoriasis, always wash your hands regularly, moisturize, and try to have regular nail maintenance. Remember to track symptoms daily in a journal to see if there’s something that may be causing the symptoms to appear. Always check with a medical professional when incorporating remedies and seeing what treatment options are available.
